page.title: 18FARMING. A TYPICAL FARM
page.content: I have a very varied type of farm,as far as the land goes,rising from approx. 500' river level to 1,000' at {Fin Cop,a Roman look out post or {tumulus,}over_looking Monsal Dale. The farm is 250 acres,130 are rough, steep grazing,typical of Derbys., incapable of much improvement, it is too steep & dangerous for tractors. The remainder is permanent grass & arable,a small amount of barley & 2 acres of potatoes.The grass is for grazing cattle & sheep,in late Spring some is fenced off for growing silage & hay for Winter feed.Over the years production has increased due to mod. methods.Chemicals are kept to a min. The pattern of farming has changed very little over 30 years,no hedges grubbed out,trees felled or walls removed.We have changed from milk to beef.Much more machinery is used.
